history.content:
I've had multiple finals on the same day and it's OK. I don't think you should change what classes you take because of that.

I would recommend taking CS 61C early. It is the gateway to the systems/architecture side of CS, and you should try it out soon in case you like it.

61C + 188 is also a decent option.

----------------------------

61C's clobber policy leads to the final being extremely important as you can basically replace your midterm scores by the score of the corresponding section on the final.

Also, I feel that taking two 3-hour back-to-back finals is highly draining, both emotionally and physically. The above anon talks of multiple finals on the same day but that is definitely not the same as taking two without any break in between. Add to that the fact that it extends up to 1am the next day (and most of your friends would be preparing to leave for their homes) and it does become quite daunting. I'd advise you against it. 170 + 188 is a better choice, in my opinion.

-------------------------------

imo agree with Anon2. Took back to back finals twice in Cal so far. It was rly draining and pretty gg. 

--------------------------------

did back to back 170+188 and thought it was okay. that being said i think 61c is more difficult than 188

--------------------------------

children.subject: I'd like to take MATH 110 to prepare for 189
You can think about taking the EECS courses 126 and 127.
If I delay 61C to junior year, what CS courses can I take besides 189 (given that I've finished 170 and 188, and I'm not very mathematically prepared for 189)?

Taking Friday finals from 7-10pm already is difficult, because it's (usually) the last exam, and you're tired and want to go home. It's far worse having an exam after 10; Think of it this way: you've just taken a three hour exam, at night, you probably spent most of the day studying, or at least awake, and then you're going to sit another 3 hour exam, which is even later at night.... you're not going to do as well as you would otherwise, and the 61C final is really important. It's draining, and there's just not enough coffee in the world to make up for it.

Take 170+188
170 and 61C have time conflict next semester
61C will never offer their alternate exam 10-1am (61C TA here). Strange to me that you’d assume that CS170 wouldn’t be the class to offer an alternate exam.

Really? I emailed 61C professors and they told me that next semester they will offer alternate exam at that time, and 170 professors told me that next semester they will not offer alternate exam. If not, could you please help me confirm 61C's alternate exam time? If it's before 170 (the same time slot as 188), I'll definitely take 61C!

I don't know who the anonymous self-claimed 61C TA is, but https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1c37Js7L4b7RQd05c7K_1okbCy3OmJjxy0zX6SAA21xs/edit#gid=1086068425 states both 61C's alternate final exam time as well as 170's lack of an alternate exam.

Feel free to not take my advice, but there's a good chance that 61C will offer an alternate exam before 7pm. Email the head 61C TA and they might give you more perspective on how alternate exams are planned.
I don't know why you're suggesting that the head TA has more information about the time of alternate exams than the professors would, but I'm increasingly skeptical of your claim that you're a TA.
The 61C final is not 10-1am. I am not sure where you'd get this kind of information.

history.content:
I really want to take 61C + 170 next semester, but the final schedule seems to be a problem (because of time conflict), since 170's final is on Friday 7 ~ 10 pm, and 61C's final is 10 ~ 1am. Has anyone have any experience with back-to-back final? Is it recommended to do so?

Another choice I'll have is to take 61C + 188 or 170 + 188, the problem with the second choice is that it seems that I can only take 61C next fall since all other courses require 61C as a prereq, and I've heard 170 is very useful for interview. Can someone please give me some suggestions?

P.S. I don't want to take summer session since I've tried before and found that although it's not too hard to get a good grade during summer, I don't find that I've learnt a lot since summer courses go very fast and CS courses are not taught by professors.
history.subject: Thoughts on back-to-back final? 61C vs 170?
